textContent:
df.drop(['columnA'], axis=1, inplace=True)

The first argument is a list of the column names you want to remove. You can remove multiple columns at once, or one at a time.

The second argument indicates you want to remove columns (axis=1) and not rows (axis=0).

The third argument indicates that you are modifying the df variable in-place. If omitted, the drop method returns the modified object and the original DataFrame remains unmodified.
title: df.drop()
textContentHtml:
df.drop(['columnA'], axis=1, inplace=True)


The first argument is a list of the column names you want to remove. You can remove multiple columns at once, or one at a time.


The second argument indicates you want to remove columns (axis=1) and not rows (axis=0).


The third argument indicates that you are modifying the df variable in-place. If omitted, the drop method returns the modified object and the original DataFrame remains unmodified.
